etymology.description: 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") + 目(目) (mù, "eye") -> hand above eyes to gaze afar -> look
etymology.interpretation: 看(kàn, "look") visually represents the action of shading eyes with one's hand to see more clearly, emphasizing the act of observing or watching.

examples.chinese: 你看那只鸟(你看那隻鳥)，在枝头跳跃(在枝頭跳躍)。
examples.pinyin: Nǐ kàn nà zhī niǎo, zài zhī tóu tiàoyuè.
examples.english: Look at that bird, it is hopping on the branch.

examples.chinese: 他看书(他看書)，仔细研究内容(仔細研究內容)。
examples.pinyin: Tā kàn shū, zǐxì yánjiū nèiróng.
examples.english: He reads the book and carefully examines its contents.
